summary:
Before moving to Netherlands due to family reasons, I worked in Moscow for different design and
building companies with projects spanned from conversion of historical buildings into luxury private
residences in the center of Moscow and St Petersburg to large-scale commercial buildings such
as International Medical Cluster or Moscow Administration Building. I also participated in several
prestigious architectural competitions.

school.name: Russian Federation, South Federal Univercity Academy of Architecture and Art

projects.title: Summer House
projects.description:
A summer house with a terrace to enjoy warm summer evenings.
Interior design of the house is an open plan, full of air and light. Its
living room also has a fireplace in case of a bad weather. The concept
embraces all the existing trees and their textures became the main
accent of the interior design while the white walls are meant to
enhance its colour.

projects.title: Architectural Concept «Nagino»
projects.description:
The site had certain limitations as to the building height and depth.
The architectural concept was done in an extremely short period of time.
The building is based on a stylobate that allows to build an underground
parking.
Retail stores occupy the ground floor.
The southern part of the building faces a park and its greenery will continue
into the building. This area is ideally located in terms of commuting to
central St.Petersburg and the concept strikes a perfect balance between
affordable luxury and beautiful nature. 
TYPE: Residential / Mixed-use
STATUS: Concept Design 
TOTAL AREA: 2012 m2

projects.title: Architectural Competition «Vanishing point»
projects.description:
Open architectural competition «Vanishing Point» was organized to select
the best concept of a square in Moscow turned into an art object.
The square was meant to become a gathering place for Moscow residents
and art lovers. We used a school of fish as the main theme of our concept
where fish became a symbol of rapidly moving city dwellers and cars.
All fish constructions were made of a polished metal and were attached
to vertical studs. Such constructions would move at each breath of the
wind creating whimsical interplay of light and reflections. There were 147
participants and our work was shortlisted by the jury of «ArchMoscow
2015» among 20 others and won a prize place.
STATUS: Short list
TYPE: Architectural Competition

projects.title: Moscow Public Administration Building
projects.description:
The concept and development of this office building were
commissioned by the government of Moscow.
The concept was done by my colleagues and I dealt with the
project adaptation, reviewing of drawings to make them compliant
to the Russian building regulations and producing meticulous
quotations for the Moscow City Hall that required all the details
due to its public financing. I also prepared the documentation to
pass the planning permission.
TYPE: Public Building
TOTAL AREA: 19 647m2

projects.title: Moscow International Medical Cluster, Moscow
projects.description:
The Moscow International Medical Cluster (MIMC) is projected to be one of the largest international hubs in Eastern Europe and a major destination center for the treatment of socially significant diseases in Russia and CIS. The concept was developed with the support from The Boston Consulting Group. 
The drawings were done in AutoCad by my colleagues and I was asked to help with modeling. I modeled the building in Revit for further reviewing with engineers and checking the architectural drawings. I modeled everything starting from concrete slabs to medical equipment installation.
TYPE: Healthcare Architecture
TOTAL AREA: 14 300 m2
STATUS: Under Construction

projects.title: Renovation of a 19-th century factory to apartments, Moscow
projects.description:
A merchant’s house at Petrovsky boulevard at the very center of Moscow formerly owned by a family of winemakers. It was a 2-strorey building with vaulted brick roof. 
My colleagues developed the architectural concept and we needed to adapt the project according to the 3d scan of the building. 
The point cloud allowed us to calculate the insolation of the adjacent territories and apartments,  
use exact measurements of the vaults, utilise thickness and curvature of the walls. 
Revit stages were used for planning and design.
TYPE: Adaptive reuse
RESIDENTIAL AREA: 10 368m2

projects.title: Concept of a prestigious residential development  «Nagornoe Village», Moscow Region, Russia
projects.description:
Very unusual project for Russia as the ground floor apartments have their own patio gardens and the roof turned into beautiful terraces with direct access to the top floor apartments. 
Meticulous planning and design due to the multiple land elevations. 
Design of a linear parking that serves as a sound barrier to protect residents from the noise from the nearby motorway and as a pedestrian route between buildings. 
Landscape design of the communal areas.
TYPE: Residential
RESIDENTIAL AREA: 15 334m2

projects.title: Interior design of Homeland Group’s new office, Moscow, Russia
projects.description:
The new Homeland’s office is located in an old factory named after Lenin (ZVI). It’s a huge space with several departments, meeting rooms, canteen and its own stage. The ceiling height is about 5.3 m, so it allowed me to use a mezzanine for extra space. To give the place an edge we kept the original cast iron tiles on the floor worn out by the feet of the factory workers. 
TYPE: Interior Design
TOTAL AREA: 1 940 m2

projects.title: Three parking sites for Domodedovo International  Airport
projects.description:
The concept of multi-level parkings and working documentation was developed to improve the airport capacity to deal with the growing number of customers. 
Open air, unheated parking for temporary use by car owners, access to the terminals via heated tunnels, access to the parking via two-level overpasses. 
Parking #1 have a public park with stalls area 
STATUS: 1st phase is ready to use, 2 other phases under construction
TOTAL AREA: Parking1 - 74 481m2, Parking2 - 134 919m2, Parking3 - 134 919m2

projects.title: Urban International Competition «Heart of the City»
projects.description:
Regeneration project of the historic center of Kaliningrad.
We tried to create an innovative concept of an urban park that would embrace the historical city center.

projects.title: Adaptive reuse of an old factory into apartments «Manhattan» building of TriBeCa apartments,Moscow, Russia
projects.description:
A former factory that produced slot machines was converted into a luxury
apartment and office complex with its own infrastructure, restaurants, clubs, gyms,
etc. The whole complex consists of 8 buildings, the building I worked on was an
office one with retail stores on the ground floor. Huge open plan areas of the
factory allowed us to create a flexible and convenient scheme of the offices.
I helped to develop the planning solutions and creating 3D model to present to the
building developers. 
TYPE: Adaptive reuse 
STATUS: Completed 
TOTAL AREA: 14 800 m2

projects.title: Architectural and Urban Concept «Sminex», Moscow, Russia
projects.description:
The concept offers to build six similar towers each turned around its own axis to avoid flats facing each other and provides for a more dynamic solution for the whole neighborhood. 
Sminex was meticulously planned to offer a full integration between urban life and nature. 
The landscaped gardens occupy over 35% of its territory. 
STATUS: Concept Design
TYPE: Residential/ Mixed use
TOTAL AREA: 145 507 m2

projects.title: Adaptive reuse of a 18th century factory converted into apartments, "Art Residence", Moscow, Russia
projects.description:
Art Residence is a high-end apartment complex at the very center of Moscow. It consists of 10 blocks of the former cigarette factory. The retails stores and offices are located on the ground floors. At the center of the complex we created an airy two-level terrace decorated with various art objects and surrounded by landscaped gardens. This area was designed to be used for art exhibitions and cultural meetings. I participated in the development of the architectural concept and also interior design of its communal areas. 
The whole complex is completed.
TYPE: Adaptive reuse / Mixed use
TOTAL AREA: 27 223 m2

projects.title: Adaptive reuse «Manhattan» building of TriBeCa apartments
